abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; project sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. The lessons the project provided related to
            the effectiveness of a separate component for land
            acquisition and economic rehabilitation in economically
            rehabilitating project affected persons; the contribution of
            an extended policy dialogue and detailed preparation to
            project implementation; the need to continue a
            multi-disciplinary approach to agricultural development
            including flexible investment in agricultural services,
            government extension services, and marketing networks. A
            focus should be put on more efficient procurement
            organization and procedures, as well as training in them;
            reconsidering the efficacy of imposing less relevant and
            difficult to enforce covenants; the need to involve
            beneficiaries in planning, implementation, and monitoring to
            improve transparency; engaging more experienced
            nongovernmental organizations capable of training less
            experienced NGOs; recognizing the role of water user
            associations as change agents, especially those involving
            women farmers; the need to contract reputed firms/make
            quality-based selection of firms for software development;
            the importance of drafting more detailed terms of reference
            for twinning consultancies; and finally, the need to
            consistently focus on policy issues, institutional
            restructuring, and cost recovery throughout project implementation.
